titlestmt.sponsor: This collection-level EAD record is a product of the Philadelphia Area Consortium of Special Collections Libraries (PACSCL) Consortial Survey Initiative, which was funded by the Andrew W. Mellon Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: Machine-readable finding aid generated in EAD from data in the PACSCL Consortial Survey Database on 12/21/2012. Modified by Dot Porter in 2017.

bioghist.p: Jerry Hoytt Boles (1907-1986) was a Presbyterian minister who was active in the Synod of Texas. He was a 1932 graduate of McCormick Theological Seminary. He was pastor of several churches in Texas and served as the Moderator of the Synod of Texas from 1950 to 1951. During the same year, he was Chairman of the National Staff of the Board of National Missions. In 1945 he became Executive of Synod of Texas, serving until 1968.

scopecontent.p: This is a collection of correspondence (incoming and outgoing) and subject files of Jerry Hoytt Boles as Executive of the Synod of Texas. Correspondents include pastors and staff of churches in the Texas Synod, staff of local and national offices of the UPCUSA, church members, and others. Subject files include materials related to the Texas Synod Council of United Presbyterian Men, the Office of New Church Development and Building Aid, Moderator visits, meetings of Executives, and various committees. These subjects files consist of correspondence, agendas, minutes, reports, and memoranda. The collection also includes some personal correspondence with family and friends.

accessrestrict.p: Access to this collection is restricted; please contact the holding institution for details.

acqinfo.p: Provenance: Unknown (appears to have been transferred from Trinity University in 1973)
